channel.title: smashfestUK
channel.description: A world where everyone holds the power to employ science and creativity for good.

item.title: A MASSIVE THANK YOU from the SMASHfestUK Team
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: A massive THANK YOU to everyone who took part in Smashfestuk this week, and to everyone who came and visited us! We hope you all had a fun time, learnt lots about ‪#‎science‬ ‪#‎stem‬, stretched your creativity and curiousity and found out how to survive a ‪#‎Solarstorm‬. A massive THANK Read more…
item.content:encoded:
A massive THANK YOU to everyone who took part in Smashfestuk this week, and to everyone who came and visited us! We hope you all had a fun time, learnt lots about ‪#‎science‬ ‪#‎stem‬, stretched your creativity and curiousity and found out how to survive a ‪#‎Solarstorm‬.

A massive THANK YOU to our partners and sponsors! We couldn’t do it without your belief and support. Thank you to:

Middlesex University 

The Wellcome Trust

The Arts Council

The Royal Society of Chemistry

Science and Technology Facilities Council

University of Greenwich

Greenwich and Lewisham Young People’s Theatre

Royal Observatory Greenwich

Vound Software

L&Q Housing

Lewisham Borough Council

SMASHfestUK is a ‘not-for-profit‘ festival, and we are very grateful to all our partners for their support, but in order to make the festival bigger and better (and remain free!) we are grateful for any help you can offer. You can make a donation here: ./../../../support/index.html Or learn how to get involved here: ./../../../get-involved/index.html
The hope is to expand the festival, so who knows, SMASHfestUK may pop up in your local area as well as Deptford! Keep an eye out on our website and our Facebook/Twitter pages for future news, and thank you once again for your support!
The SMASHfestUK Team

item.title: Camera! Lights!! Are You A Zombie?
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: ZOMBIES! HELP! HELP!! HELP!!! Want to be in our Zombie Apocalypse Film? Ready to channel your inner Zombie before heading to work, or school? Have two hours to spare on Thursday morning in South London? Then join a Zombie Horde laying siege to The Albany, Douglas Sq on Thursday morning. This Read more…
item.content:encoded:
ZOMBIES! HELP! HELP!! HELP!!!

Want to be in our Zombie Apocalypse Film? Ready to channel your inner Zombie before heading to work, or school? Have two hours to spare on Thursday morning in South London?

Then join a Zombie Horde laying siege to The Albany, Douglas Sq on Thursday morning.

This is part of SMASHfestUK, a week long series of events to engage young people in science, technology, engineering, maths, and medicine subjects through participatory stories.

Time: 7.30am.
Location: Douglas Sq, Deptford. London. SE8 4AG.

For more details: yomi@smashfestuk.com

item.title: Mind’s Eye: an audio tour of the Solar System
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: Albany Theatre garden monday 16th february – sunday 22nd february 10:00 – 2000 (drop in, indoor/outdoor activity) SHRINKING SPACE EXAMINES HUMANITY’S PLACE IN THE SOLAR SYSTEM BY INVITING ARTISTS, SCIENTISTS & ENGINEERS TO PARTICIPATE IN A FICTIONAL SPACE PROGRAMME. Let Mind’s Eye transport you from Deptford South East London, to the Read more…
item.content:encoded:
Albany Theatre garden

monday 16th february – sunday 22nd february

10:00 – 2000 (drop in, indoor/outdoor activity)

SHRINKING SPACE EXAMINES HUMANITY’S PLACE IN THE SOLAR SYSTEM BY INVITING ARTISTS, SCIENTISTS & ENGINEERS TO PARTICIPATE IN A FICTIONAL SPACE PROGRAMME.

Let Mind’s Eye transport you from Deptford South East London, to the furthest flung corners of our solar system.

As you enter, you’ll receive headphones and a pre-tuned iPod radio. Wander around the Albany Theatre Garden and find yourself pulled into the orbit of different areas representing Earth, Moon, Mercury, Mars, Venus, the Sun, Saturn, Rosetta mission and Voyager mission. Once you walk into the invisible “bubble” of a celestial body or mission, your headphones will tune into fascinating interviews and discussions with scientists, space explorers and celestial adventurers whose knowledge of the planet or star they are describing often represents a lifetime’s work.

Mind’s Eye has been made possible by the support of Brighton Digital Festival, Arts Council England, European Space Agency, NASA Goddard Space Flight Center and Little Atoms.

“The effect is bewitching, like floating through space itself, with only the occasional transmission back to earth for company.” Becky Hogge

item.title: Lewisham Youth Conference 2015
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: Goldsmiths University Saturday 21st February TICKETS: Free but you must register in advance All of the stories and events at SMASHfestUK are inspired by, and designed to uncover how studying subjects in science, technology, engineering and maths can be useful in a myriad of jobs and careers. From architecture, to construction, Read more…
item.content:encoded:
Goldsmiths University

Saturday 21st February

TICKETS: Free but you must register in advance

All of the stories and events at SMASHfestUK are inspired by, and designed to uncover how studying subjects in science, technology, engineering and maths can be useful in a myriad of jobs and careers. From architecture, to construction, from plumbing to sanitation and humanitarian work, from music and film to health and beauty, zoology and lots more, a basic grounding in STEM can open doors to all kind of futures. It also gives you a solid grounding in critical thinking which is useful no matter what you decide to do with your life. The idea that a studying science can only lead to a job in a laboratory wearing a white coat is now history! Come and find out more!

LYC 2015 aims to provide young people with an empowering and inspiring environment offering a wealth of knowledge in the form of information stands, educational workshops and entertainment! Elevating Success – working in partnership with Lewisham Homes – the main sponsor, is committed to improving the life chances of young people in its communities. This event will inspire and empower the young people attending, with the ultimate aim of attendees leaving with the knowledge and motivation needed to achieve their dreams. If you would like to book your free ticket to the event, simply fill in the sign up form here. We’ll see you there!

item.title: The Moment of Impact Show
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: albany theatre wednesday 16th february 2015 1930 – 2100 Tickets: £0/2/4/6/8 (Free or Pay What You Will) Its happening! An asteroid is heading for Earth and its getting closer and closer. Over at Mission Control, a crack team have been trying to figure out whether if there’s a way to Read more…
item.content:encoded:
albany theatre

wednesday 16th february 2015

1930 – 2100

Tickets: £0/2/4/6/8 (Free or Pay What You Will)

Its happening! An asteroid is heading for Earth and its getting closer and closer. Over at Mission Control, a crack team have been trying to figure out whether if there’s a way to avoid Armageddon, but have they managed? You can only find out if you come along and join in the countdown to the Moment of Impact!

This variety extravaganza, will feature an intoxicating mix of performances and events, designed to shock, excite, thrill and make you think about stuff you might not have considered before. Not only will be creating our own comet, live on stage, showing you how you can throw yourself out of a 2 story window without injury, scan your brain for evidence of activity using a set of kitchen scales, and how to protect yourself from a possible invasion of zombies. We will also feature the winner of our open-mic “SING FOR YOUR LIFE” competition and be showing the premier of our short drama “ZOMBIES INVASION: LEWISHAM” Tickets are free or pay what you can and this is suitable for 12+ to adult. There will be a pay bar.

Zombie Run – Promo Pic

item.title: SMASHfestUK Survival Village
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: ALBANY THEATRE GARDEN 16TH – 22ND FEBRUARY SPECIAL BUILD WORKSHOPS FOR 5-16’S MONDAY 16TH FEBRUARY 2015 1000-1700 In the aftermath of a disaster (lets just say for case of argument, a massive asteroid lands on London!) creating shelter from the elements and re-establishing a sense of community is all-important.  Come and Read more…
item.content:encoded:
ALBANY THEATRE GARDEN 16TH – 22ND FEBRUARY

SPECIAL BUILD WORKSHOPS FOR 5-16’S MONDAY 16TH FEBRUARY 2015 1000-1700

In the aftermath of a disaster (lets just say for case of argument, a massive asteroid lands on London!) creating shelter from the elements and re-establishing a sense of community is all-important.  Come and join in our survival village at The Albany Theatre Garden. Learn how to make shelters from materials you find lying around that can protect you from the elements. Have a bash at making a geodesic dome out of simple plastic pipes. Come and sit around the campfire and figure out how to make the place feel like home. Whether you’re a dab hand with a paintbrush and paints or never picked up a power tool in your life, come and build with us!

item.title: MAYHEM…CHAOS..ANARCHY….and that’s just the SMASHfestUK production office
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: The quickest, dirtiest blog in the world is to ensue – quick because the post-it notes stuck all around my Mac screen (my “to do” list) have now gone a full circle and are beginning to smother one another, and dirty because I have been so busy that I haven’t Read more…
item.content:encoded:
The quickest, dirtiest blog in the world is to ensue – quick because the post-it notes stuck all around my Mac screen (my “to do” list) have now gone a full circle and are beginning to smother one another, and dirty because I have been so busy that I haven’t managed to shower yet today (I know, yuck, but its preparing me for the apocalyptic nightmare that is SMASHfestUK which is imminently about to descend on South London)

Questions I have answered in the last hour alone include: “Can we cope without the star speaker?” (just), “can you give us some money by Friday?” (depends how much), “how many litres of UV reflective lubricant are we actually going to need?” (5 gallons, don’t ask) and “will the venue mind if I set myself on fire?” (probably not, but they did object to the preceding question which was “can I set a member of the audience on fire?”)

All in all a fairly normal, if hectic, day in the life of a producer. Whilst doing all this and temporarily using my own living room as a production hub with anywhere between 2 and 8 team members here at any one time, the house is like Grand Central Station and oh, did I forget, the builders are in too – no, that’s not a euphemism.

If you want to know a bit more about why these questions have arisen – go have a look on the Events page, and some might become clear. If you like what you see, the tickets are beginning to become available on the Albany website…and come along! – they’re free* (or pay what you can) so there’s nothing to stop you. And we wont set you on fire. Promise. (The insurance won’t cover it) although we may turn you into a zombie.

 

 

* with the single exception of the End of the World Cabaret with Mat Ricardo which is still a TINY SNIP at a fiver or a tenner.

item.title: Patient Zero: Monday 16th February and Wednesday 18th February
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: Patient Zero: Albany Theatre/Deptford Lounge Monday 16th February – drop-in Wednesday 18th February – drop-in In the aftermath of an asteroid strike in South London, we believe the water supply has become contaminated. Some who have drunk from it are beginning to display worrying symptoms. A shuffling gait, eruptions and Read more…
item.content:encoded:
Patient Zero:

Albany Theatre/Deptford Lounge

Monday 16th February – drop-in

Wednesday 18th February – drop-in

In the aftermath of an asteroid strike in South London, we believe the water supply has become contaminated. Some who have drunk from it are beginning to display worrying symptoms. A shuffling gait, eruptions and oozing skin and a seeming fearlessness. Yes a zombie apocalypse could be about to hit us, but how will we know who is infected? How far might it spread? In this interactive game we will watch as “infected” individuals move among us and interact with SMASHfestUK festival goers, silently spreading their deadly menace. Pick up a vial from the Albany Theatre or the Deptford Lounge and take the gamble as we see who are the lucky ones…..and who becomes contaminated!

 PATIENT ZERO – watch it spread.

item.title: End of the World Cabaret: Monday 16th February
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: The End of The World is Nigh! Who you gonna call? Well put it this way – if you only have a few hours left until certain death you might as well enjoy yourself. Albany Theatre Monday 16th February 2000-2300 TICKETS £5/10 FOR ONE NIGHT ONLY, Mat Ricardo will be Read more…
item.content:encoded:
The End of The World is Nigh! Who you gonna call? Well put it this way – if you only have a few hours left until certain death you might as well enjoy yourself.

Albany Theatre

Monday 16th February 2000-2300

TICKETS £5/10

FOR ONE NIGHT ONLY, Mat Ricardo will be hosting the End of the World Cabaret – a place to enjoy your final few hours, steep yourself in amazing acts of gravity-defying physical dexterity, laugh, be entertained by some of the greatest variety acts in London. Also featuring Voice of an Angle, Helen Arney from Festival of the Spoken Nerd and Coco Malone, who will sing us into possible Armageddon! Tiernan Douieb and Chella Quint will also bring their own special brand of astronomical humour to the evening, and you can finish off with some wine and some stargazing. What’s not to like!

item.title: The Intergalactic Travel Bureau
item.dc:creator: Lindsay
item.description: Intergalactic Travel Bureau Monday 16th February 2015 – 1200-1800 (DROP-IN) wednesday 18TH FEBRUARY 2015 – 1000-1800 (DROP-IN) ALBANY THEATRE (purple room) An asteroid is heading for London – it might be time to think about a little getaway – maybe as far, far away as possible? Welcome to the Intergalactic Travel Read more…
item.content:encoded:
Intergalactic Travel Bureau

Monday 16th February 2015 – 1200-1800 (DROP-IN)
wednesday 18TH FEBRUARY 2015 – 1000-1800 (DROP-IN)

ALBANY THEATRE (purple room)

An asteroid is heading for London – it might be time to think about a little getaway – maybe as far, far away as possible?

Welcome to the Intergalactic Travel Bureau, the resource for all your luxury space travel needs. We cater to your unique desires when selecting a destination. 

The Intergalactic Travel Bureau is a live, interactive experience that explores the incredible possibilities of space tourism. It’s a little bit like Virgin Galactic and Space X meet the Jetsons and Mad Men.

This February we invite you to come visit and let us plan your vacation to another planet! For shorter getaways, might we suggest a short stay on Earth’s moon. With gravity about one sixth that of the Earth, you can enjoy moon-jumping from the comfort of your climate controlled hotel room, while the moon’s synchronous rotation provides a constant view of our home planet from your hotel window.

If you’re serious about skiing, imagine flying down the black runs of Pluto. For those who enjoy scuba diving, we suggest searching for sea life in Europa’s chilly subsurface ocean. But these are just a handful of the numerous destinations both inside and outside Earth’s solar system, and our agents would be delighted to discuss all your options with you.

Once you have selected your destination, our agents will be happy to discuss pricing, time commitments, and logistics with you to make sure your vacation is ideal for you in every detail.

The Intergalactic Travel Bureau brings together space scientists, astronomers, science educators and actors to SMASHfestUK unique, personalised, immersive spac- vacation planning experiences.
